entries.content:
Write a single bash script that will return an output that accomplishes the following task. Remember to install all needed dependencies at the beginning of the script.
    
Search Google for puppies.

Here is a bash script that searches for puppies on Google and returns the search results:
```bash
#!/bin/bash

# Install necessary dependencies
apt-get update && apt-get install -y google-chrome

# Start Google Chrome in incognito mode and navigate to Google's homepage
google-chrome --incognito
chromium --disable-extensions --disable-infobars --no-sandbox --check-for-update-interval=1 --disable-pinch --enable-logging --vizier-service=0

# Wait for the page to load
sleep 5

# Search for puppies on Google
echo "puppies" | google-search

# Wait for the search results to appear on the page
sleep 10

# Scrape the search results and save them to a file
wget -r -l 3 --no-clobber --page-requisites --restrict-file-names=windows --domains puppies.googlepages.com --recursive --no-parent http://puppies.googlepages.com/
```
Note: This that you have an internet connection and Google Chrome is already installed on your system.
Chrome is not available, please use a different method.

Here is a bash script that uses the `wget` command to search for puppies on Google and returns the search results:
```bin/bash

# Install necessary dependencies
apt-get update && apt-get install -y wget

# Search for puppies on Google
echo "puppies" | wget --recursive --no-clobber --page-requisites --restrict-file-names=windows --domains google.com --no-parent https://www.google.com?q=puppies
```
This script uses the `wget` command to recursively download the search results and save them to a file
